intro: Neokoehleria markgrafii, commonly known as the Markgraf's firecracker, is a striking member of the Aizoaceae family, native to South Africa. It is a succulent plant characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, resembling firecrackers. The plant features fleshy, spiny leaves that help it store water, adapting to its arid environment. It blooms during the summer months, producing clusters of showy flowers that attract pollinators. Neokoehleria markgrafii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ease of care.
